case.name: Brake v Townsend (with Corrigendum dated 29 August 2006) [2006] FCA 1156 (29 August 2006)

citphrases.citphrase: whether trustee should be satisfied that all the bankrupt's debts have been paid in full -trustee entitled not to be satisfied that all of the bankrupt's debts have been paid in full until satisfied that proofs have been lodged in relation to all provable debts and a decision has been made on those proofs
words and phrases "act, omission or decision of the trustee" for purposes of s.178 of bankruptcy act 1966
trustee's responses to request by the bankrupt may constitute an "act".
trustee other than salaried official receiver or gratuitous trustee
whether personal to trustee or one assignable and transmissible
official receiver appointed trustee in his stead
application by legal personal representative of deceased trustee to have court fix remuneration, creditors having failed so to do
fixing of a trustee's remuneration for the administration of an estate
consideration of the court's jurisdiction to fix a trustee's remuneration.

citances.sentence: Further guidance has more recently been provided by the Federal Court in Brake v Townsend [2006] FCA 1156.
